repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Some context can be found here:

- https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/3509

**Problem:**

Language server version information is missing from `:checkhealth vim.lsp`.

**Solution:**

Store [`InitializeResult.serverInfo.version`](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#initializeResult) from the `initialize` response and display for each client in `:checkhealth vim.lsp`.

comment_data.body: Hmm I suppose the guard is actually redundant. We could also add some zero values instead of `nil` (e.g. `{name = '', version = ''}`) to make accessing it nicer/easier.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -556,6 +560,10 @@ function Client:initialize()
       self.offset_encoding = self.server_capabilities.positionEncoding
     end
 
+    if result.serverInfo then
+      self.server_info = result.serverInfo
+    end

comment_data.body:
similar to https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/9f2c279cf9abe584f03bfeb37c6658d68e3ff49d/lua/lspconfig/health.lua#L82 , it's good to surface a hint about what failed. that puts pressure on upstreams to fix their crap.

```suggestion
      local server_version = vim.tbl_get(client, 'server_info', 'version') or '? (no serverInfo.version response)'
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,7 @@ local function check_active_clients()
   local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients()
   if next(clients) then
     for _, client in pairs(clients) do
+      local server_version = vim.tbl_get(client, 'server_info', 'version') or 'n/a'

comment_data.body:
> We could also add some zero values instead of `nil`

Doesn't that make testing for "not found / unknown" more difficult?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -556,6 +560,10 @@ function Client:initialize()
       self.offset_encoding = self.server_capabilities.positionEncoding
     end
 
+    if result.serverInfo then
+      self.server_info = result.serverInfo
+    end

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
â€¢ `:checkhealth vim.lsp` displays the server version (if available).
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -115,6 +115,8 @@ LSP
 â€¢ |vim.lsp.util.make_position_params()|, |vim.lsp.util.make_range_params()|
   and |vim.lsp.util.make_given_range_params()| now require the `position_encoding`
   parameter.
+â€¢ `:checkhealth vim.lsp` will now displays language server version of those
+  that support it.

comment_regular_data.body:
> Should I updated `news.txt` as well?

Sure, in the LSP section.

> What are the results for servers that you use?

Here's a selection of some of the servers I use every now and then. Seems to be a mixed bag.

| --- | --- | --- |
| bash-language-server | | :x:
| clangd | Apple clangd version 16.0.0 (clang-1600.0.26.4) mac+xpc arm64-apple-darwin24.1.0 | :white_check_mark:
| [copilot.vim](https://github.com/github/copilot.vim) | 1.236.0 | :white_check_mark:
| gleam | | :x: |
| gopls | {"GoVersion":"go1.23.4", ...} [^1] | :white_check_mark: :warning:
| lua-ls / sumneko | | :x: (only supports `serverInfo.name`)
| nim-lang/langserver | | :x:
| pyright | | :x:
| ruff | 0.6.2 | :white_check_mark:
| rust-analyzer | 0.0.0 (27e824fad4 2024-12-15) | :white_check_mark: 
| typos-lsp | 0.1.31 | :white_check_mark:
| vtsls | 0.2.6 | :white_check_mark:
| zls | 0.13.0 | :white_check_mark:

> Here's a selection of some of the servers I use every now and then. Seems to be a mixed bag.

At least 50%, that's pretty good. 

LGTM

> At least 50%, that's pretty good.

I can image those with popular VS Code extensions might have support for it. VS Code is probably showing/using it somewhere, they are the drivers behind most things in the spec after all. In the case of pyright, a hunch is that the support lives in pylance instead (since that's the extension).
I suppose you could use the information to notify the user about a new version of a language server and things like that.

Regarding the odd gopls version information. It seems to be an issue with how Homebrew builds it. You need some linker flags to set the correct version, otherwise it will just build debug information (`runtime/debug.ReadBuildInfo(...)`).

I have opened a pull request to hopefully address it:

- https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/201732

Update: seems like the above might not be enough ðŸ¤”

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): add server version information to `:checkhealth`
